snippet: The Internet and TV provide young women with a view of a better life unencumbered by tradition.
abstract: Sinjar Journal; Iraqi officials are alarmed by what they describe as a worsening epidemic of suicides, particularly among young women tormented by being forced to marry too young, to someone they do not love; one of many explanations offered most frequently is access to the Internet and to satellite television, which has given young women glimpses of a better life, unencumbered by the traditions that have constricted women for centuries.

byline.contributor: Duraid Adnan contributed reporting from Sinjar and Baghdad.

lead_paragraph: The Internet and TV provide young women with a view of a better life unencumbered by tradition.

headline.seo: More Suicides in Iraq Region Where Arranged Marriage Is Common
headline.main: Where Arranged Marriages Are Customary, Suicides Grow More Common
headline.print_headline: Where Arranged Marriages Are Customary, Suicides Grow More Common
